data.title: Jacob Nestor (abt.1761-1844)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for Jacob Nestor born abt. 1761 Germany died 1844 Nestorville, Barbour, West Virginia, United States including research + descendants + 1 photos + 2 genealogist comments + DNA connections + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Son of [father unknown] and [mother unknown]

[sibling(s) unknown]

Descendants

Profile last modified 27 Jun 2022 | Created 26 Jul 2015

This page has been accessed 1,315 times.

Biography

Birth: 1761, Germany Death: Jan. 31, 1844 Nestorville, Barbour County, West Virginia, USA

Married Oct. 10, 1785 to Mary Magdalene Durr. The current belief is that Jacob was brought from Germany to America by his father to help establish a new life in Pennsylvania. His father returned to bring Jacob's mother to the new home, and was never heard from again. Jacob fought in the American Revolution and was given a tract of land in what is now Barbour County WV as payment for his service. He is buried near the town of Nestorville WV.

A different family tradition communicated to C. F. Nestor by Jacob's great grandson, George Miller, Jacob "was eight years old when he came to America, and [Jacob's] last remembrance of his mother was at sea on night when she was 'wrapped in white and laid up.' He said his mother was French. His father stayed in America about three years and then returned to Germany to settle up some business. [The father] was supposed to return on a certain voyage, but did not, nor was he ever heard from again. It was presumed that he too was lost at sea on the return to America."[1]

Jacob Nestor served with Berks County Militia, Pennsylvania Militia during the American Revolution.

Military service: "enrolled sometime during the period 1777-1778 as a Private, First Class, Captain Ferdinand Ritter's Eighth Company, Third Battalion, Berks County Militia, according to the evidence of the Fine Book of Berks County, page 35." [2]

Notes

Find a Grave Memorial 49677045 cites 14 Mar 1761 as DOB.[3]

Sources

Will of JACOB NESTER, of Randolph County, Virginia

Signed: 21 May 1842; Proved 17 October 1846 in Barbour County

Bequests to: wife, Elizabeth Nester; children: George Nester, Samuel Nester, David Nester, Daniel Nester, John Nester, Mary [Nester] Shaffer, Elizabeth [Nester] Cox. Executor: son, Daniel Nester
